sen.j: 平 国香（たいら の くにか 平 國香、生年未詳 - 承平 (日本)5年（935年）2月 (旧暦)）は、平安時代中期の武将。
sen.e: TAIRA no Kunika (year of birth unknown - March, 935 [old calendar]) was a busho (Japanese military commander) lived in the mid-Heian period.
sen.cmt: 承平5年の旧暦2月が、西暦935年の3月上旬～4月上旬のようなので、ここでは3月としてあります。
sen.e: TAIRA no Kunika (year of birth unknown-February, 935 [old calendar]) was a busho (Japanese military commander) lived in the mid-Heian period.
sen.cmt: 特に新暦に直す必要はないとの事ですので、旧暦に変更しました。ハイフン前後のスペース削除しました。
sen.e: TAIRA no Kunika (year of birth unknown-March, 935) was a busho (Japanese military commander) lived in the mid-Heian period.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ歴に変更しました。

sen.e: He was the first son of TAIRA no Takamochi.

sen.j: 常陸平氏や伊勢平氏の祖。
sen.e: He is an ancestor of Hitachi-Heishi (Taira clan) and Ise-Heishi (Taira clan).
He is the ancestor of Hitachi-Heishi (Taira clan) and Ise-Heishi (Taira clan).
sen.cmt: 冠詞の変更しました。
sen.e: He is the ancestor of Hitachi-Heishi (Taira clan) and Ise-Heishi (Taira clan).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 寛平元年5月13日 (旧暦)（889年6月14日）、宇多天皇の勅命により平姓を賜与され臣籍降下した。
sen.e: He was given the surname of Taira and demoted from nobility to subject by the Imperial order of Emperor Uda on June 14, 889.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was given the surname of Taira and was demoted from the Imperial family to a subject by the Imperial order of Emperor Uda on June 14, 889.
sen.cmt: 用語統一からはずれますが、臣籍降下は皇族を離れることなので、nobilityを変更しました。Wasを追加、冠詞挿入しました。
sen.e: He was given the surname of Taira and was demoted from the Imperial family to a subject by the Imperial order of Emperor Uda on June 18, 889.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ歴に変更しました。

sen.j: 昌泰元年（898年）に上総国介に任じられた父の高望とともに坂東に下向、常陸国筑波山西麓の東石田を本拠地とした。
sen.e: He left the capital for Bando region with his father Takamochi who was appointed to Kazusa no kuni no suke (officer in charge of regional administration in Kazusa) and based in Higashi-ishita at the western foot of Mt. Tsukuba in Hitachi Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 898, he left the capital for Bando region with his father Takamochi who was appointed Kazusa no kuni no suke (officer in charge of regional administration in Kazusa) and based on Higashi-ishita at the western foot of Mt. Tsukuba in Hitachi Province.
sen.cmt: 年号抜け補完、to削除、前置詞変更しました。
sen.e: In 898, he left the capital for Bando region with his father Takamochi who was appointed Kazusa no kuni no suke (officer in charge of regional administration in Kazusa) and based on Higashi-ishita at the western foot of Mt. Tsukuba in Hitachi Province.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 源護の娘を妻とし、前任の常陸大掾である護よりその地位を受け継ぐ。
sen.e: He married a daughter of MINAMOTO no Mamoru and took over Mamoru's post of the former Hitachi no daijo (Senior Secretary of Hitachi Province).

sen.j: 坂東平氏の勢力を拡大、その後各地に広がる高望王流桓武平氏の基盤を固めた。
sen.e: He had extended the power of Bando-Heishi (Taira clan) and then strengthened the foundation of Kanmu-Heishi (Taira clan), the line of Prince Takamochi, being expanded many parts of the country.

sen.j: 舅である護の子源扶に要撃された甥の平将門が、承平5年（935年）2月4日 (旧暦)に反撃に出た際、居館の石田館が焼かれ死亡した。
sen.e: When his nephew TAIRA no Masakado was attacked from ambush by MINAMOTO no Tasuku who was Kunika's father-in-law, namely a son of Mamoru and went on the counterattack on March 16, 935, Kunika was killed in a fire of his residence called Ishida-kan.
sen.cmt: 2月4日 (旧暦)は新暦に換算して3月16日と訳してあります。
sen.e: When his nephew TAIRA no Masakado was attacked by ambushing MINAMOTO no Tasuku who was a son of Kunika's father-in-law, Mamoru and went on the counterattack on February 4, 935, Kunika was killed in a fire of his residence called Ishida-kan.
sen.cmt: ambushingに変更、源扶は舅ではないので訂正、特に新暦に直す必要はないとの事ですので、旧暦に変更しました。
sen.e: When his nephew TAIRA no Masakado was attacked by ambushing MINAMOTO no Tasuku who was a son of Kunika's father-in-law, Mamoru and went on the counterattack on March 16, 935, Kunika was killed in a fire of his residence called Ishida-kan.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ歴に変更しました。

sen.j: 京都で馬寮在任中にこの報せを聞いた子の平貞盛は休暇を申請して急遽帰国。
sen.e: His son TAIRA no Sadamori, who had heard the news during his term at Meryo (the section taking care of imperial horses) in Kyoto, applied for vacation to go back home in a hurry.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 一時は旧怨を水に流し将門との和平路線を取ろうとするも、叔父の平良兼に批判・説得されて将門に敵対する事となり、承平天慶の乱の発端となった。
sen.e: Even though he had tried to bury old hatred and bring about a reconciliation once, his uncle TAIRA no Yoshikane criticized and persuaded him to be hostile to Masakado, which prefaced the Johei and Tengyo War.
